channel.title: Java Bug System
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [JDK-8328303] 3 JDI tests timed out with UT enabled
item.description:
The following 3 tests timed out in the JDK23 CI with UT enabled:

vmTestbase/nsk/jdi/EventRequestManager/threadDeathRequests/thrdeathreq001/TestDescription.java
vmTestbase/nsk/jdi/ClassPrepareEvent/thread/thread001/TestDescription.java
vmTestbase/nsk/jdi/ClassPrepareEvent/referenceType/refType001/TestDescription.java

thrdeathreq001 log snippet:

2) Getting ThreadDeathRequest objects with enabled event requests...
Found expected ThreadDeathRequest object with the property: (first,a quick)
Found expected ThreadDeathRequest object with the property: (second,brown)
Found expected ThreadDeathRequest object with the property: (third,fox)
Found expected ThreadDeathRequest object with the property: (fourth,jumps)
Found expected ThreadDeathRequest object with the property: (fifth,over)
Found expected ThreadDeathRequest object with the property: (sixth,the lazy)
Found expected ThreadDeathRequest object with the property: (seventh,dog)
EventListener: following JDI event occured: ThreadDeathEvent in thread UsageTracker
EventListener: following JDI event occured: ThreadDeathEvent in thread UsageTracker
EventListener: following JDI event occured: ThreadDeathEvent in thread UsageTracker
EventListener: following JDI event occured: ThreadDeathEvent in thread UsageTracker
EventListener: following JDI event occured: ThreadDeathEvent in thread UsageTracker
EventListener: following JDI event occured: ThreadDeathEvent in thread UsageTracker
EventListener: following JDI event occured: ThreadDeathEvent in thread UsageTracker
EventListener: exiting
Timeout signalled after 480 seconds
# ERROR: TEST FAILED: debuggee's process finished with status: 134
The following stacktrace is for failure analysis.

at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.DirectMethodHandleAccessor.invoke(DirectMethodHandleAccessor.java:103)
at java.base/java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:580)
at com.sun.javatest.regtest.agent.MainWrapper$MainTask.run(MainWrapper.java:138)
at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:1575)


#>
#> SUMMARY: Following errors occured
#> during test execution:
#>
# ERROR: TEST FAILED: debuggee's process finished with status: 134
----------System.err:(0/0)----------
----------rerun:(40/10287)*----------

item.summary: 3 JDI tests timed out with UT enabled

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
A pull request was submitted for review.
Branch: master
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk17u-dev/pull/2893
Date: 2024-09-18 14:22:08 +0000

A pull request was submitted for review.
Branch: master
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk21u-dev/pull/967
Date: 2024-09-12 11:53:19 +0000

Fix request [17u,21u]

I backport this to improve testing. Backport of 8326898 would make the timeouts fixed here more likely.
No risk, only a test change.
Clean backport.
Tests using modified files passes. SAP nightly testing passed.

The fix for this bug is integrated in jdk-23+16-1241 which has currently
gotten as far as Tier5. So hopefully it will reach Tier7 later today!!

Changeset: bc739639
Author: Alex Menkov <amenkov@openjdk.org>
Date: 2024-03-22 23:30:54 +0000
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/commit/bc73963974a824d77d54b8b0edbf8f05262b721c

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/pull/18442
Date: 2024-03-21 22:25:23 +0000
[~dcubed] Performing final testing of the fix before sending to review

[~amenkov] - Will you have a fix for this one soon or should we temporarily
ProblemList it to reduce the noise in Tier7? It happens in almost every Tier7
job set...
[~cjplummer] I suppose JDK-8326898 made debugee a bit faster (no need to resolve network addresses), so now testing starts when UT thread is not exited yet.
[~amenkov] Your description of the issue and the UT thread's involvement makes sense, but I don't understand why we didn't start seeing this issue until after JDK-8326898.
ClassPrepareEvent/referenceType/refType001/TestDescription.java works similar to lassPrepareEvent/thread/thread001/TestDescription.java and has the same issue

ClassPrepareEvent/thread/thread001/TestDescription.java is the test issue as well:
The test requests ClassPrepareEvent with SUSPEND_ALL policy, but EventHandler exits as soon as expected events from test threads are received (the test disables ClassPrepareRequest later)
So ClassPrepareEvent from any non-test thread causes debuggee hang.

threadDeathRequests/thrdeathreq001 failure is the test issue:
The test creates 7 ThreadDeathRequests with the default suspend policy (SUSPEND_ALL)
EventListener reads events from the debuggee in a cycle.
It logs received events and calls eventSet.resume() only if isConnected is 'true'.
But quitDebuggee() method sets isConnected to 'false', so there is a race here - EventListener can get one of the ThreadDeathEvent, but doesn't resume the VM
This seems to reproduce on every run. Was introduced by JDK-8326898.

These timeouts started happening in jdk-23+15-1099-tier7. The previous Tier7
was jdk-23+14-1047-tier7 and jdk-23+15-1099-tier7 contains a total of 70
change sets relative to jdk-23+14-1047-tier7. I scrolled thru them and nothing
obvious jumped out at me.

[~cjplummer] - Can you think of something that has changed recently that might
explain why these timeouts are happening?

I looked at a thread001 failure. The debuggee exited with 134, which is due to the test timing out and the debuggee being forced to core dump. The core dump shows the main thread doing I/O trying to read the QUIT command.

0x00007f929022127d * nsk.share.jpda.SocketIOPipe.readln() bci:15 line:195 (Interpreted frame)
0x00007f929022127d * nsk.jdi.ClassPrepareEvent.thread.thread001a.runIt(java.lang.String[], java.io.PrintStream) bci:203 line:130 (Interpreted frame)
0x00007f9290221160 * nsk.jdi.ClassPrepareEvent.thread.thread001a.main(java.lang.String[]) bci:15 line:39 (Interpreted frame)

            // wait for command QUIT from debugger to release started threads and exit
            command = pipe.readln(); <--- LINE 130

The debugger is generating the failure a little after having sent the QUIT command:

            // force debugee to exit
            log.display("Sending command: " + COMMAND_QUIT);
            pipe.println(COMMAND_QUIT);

            // wait for debuggee exits and analize its exit code
            log.display("Waiting for debuggee terminating");
            int debuggeeStatus = debuggee.endDebugee();
            if (debuggeeStatus == PASSED + JCK_STATUS_BASE) {
                log.display("Debuggee PASSED with exit code: " + debuggeeStatus);
            } else {
                log.complain("Debuggee FAILED with exit code: " + debuggeeStatus);
                testFailed = true;
            }

So basically the debugger expects the debuggee to exit once it gets the QUIT command, and it should exit with 95. Since it never exits and is forced to core dump, instead the exit code is 134 due to the forced core dump.

I can't think of how UT might be causing this failure. I'm also pretty sure we have one or two other CRs filed with JDI tests timing out in a similar manner (debuggee never getting a QUIT command that has been sent).
